comments.author: Seal.5964
comments.body:
Hello!

You should have a look here:
http://wiki.guildwars2.com/wiki/API
Specifically at the apps and wrappers.

I imagine developing parts of the API is not a one-man job, but from all them wrappers and apps, some should need some help!

There are some more useful tools that haven’t been written yet.

If you’re keen on expanding your linguistics, have a look at wrappers written in languages you don’t know. The wrappers themselves, if written well, are simple enough to showcase a language clearly enough.

comments.author: Strategist.6132
comments.body:
Hello everyone!,

I decided I’d like to be more active on the API community since I am studying computer science in the 3d year now. I really like Guild Wars (2) and I hope I could make some contribution to it.

So I was wondering: Are there still things that need to be done that I can do? I have knowledge in programming with C++, Java and the standard webdevelopment skills. (HTML5, CSS, Javascript, and some PHP) But I also wouldn’t mind writing documentation or other things.

I have 3 weeks of vacation from university so there is plenty of time.
I hope you guys know something I can assist with!

Have a nice week everyone!,

Strategist
